results.title: Once upon a time in China II
results.creator_credit: Golden Harvest, Film Workshop and Tsui Hark
results.brief_description: Although not as bleak as the first in the series, the conflict between cultures and the rapidly changing values of the late 19th. century is the theme of this martial arts film starring asian champion Jet Lee. He clings to tradition in a China weakened by the invasion of imperialist forces while others like Sun Yat-Sen adapt to the change. There is plenty of hair-raising action and the final showdown in the Temple of the White Lotus will amaze. In Cantonese with English and Chinese subtitles.

results.title: Once upon a time in China (Restored version) [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Golden Harvest, Film Workshop and Tsui Hark
results.brief_description: The first of one of the classic Kung Fu films starring champion Jet Li as legendary martial arts folk hero, Wong Fei Hung. Set in a time when foreign traders and Jesuit priests were beginning to enter China, Wong Fei Hung leads the Black Army, a local militia determined to protect the town against the evil forces which operate in it. An action film which will amaze and astound as Jet Li performs a series of heroic feats, defeating any evil in his path. Restored widescreen version containing over 10 minutes of footage previously not included on video. In Cantonese with English and Chinese subtitles.

results.title: Once upon a time in America (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Embassy International Pictures, Arnon Milchan and Sergio Leone
results.brief_description: Crime, passion and a lust for power - an explosive saga of gangland America. Its extraordinary craftsmanship, together with its exceptional levels of acting and storytelling, place it among such other R-rated classics as “The Deerhunter”, “The Godfather”, “Midnight Express” and “A Clockwork Orange”. Stars Robert De Niro, James Woods and Elizabeth McGovern.

results.title: Once Upon a Time ...
results.brief_description:
Episode 26 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
Man has always been bad at planning. This episode takes us forward in time to show us the potentially fatal consequence of our inability or illwill to care for the environement and consider ecologically sustainable responses to developement. Topics include: recycling, crisis for resources, nuclear destruction and space exploration.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: Once upon a time
results.creator_credit: Antelope Films, Channel 4 and Mischa Scorer
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Testament: The Bible and history”.
Part one examines the literal truth of the Old Testament, in particular Genesis,by looking at archaelogical evidence found near the ancient sites of Mesopotamia. These ancient cultures with their parallel “biblical” stories are also discussed. In Part two, the story of Exodus is examined by looking at the historical evidence found in Egypt and how the concept of “God” changed from this time.

results.title: Once upon a time
results.creator_credit: Texture Films, Barbara O'Connell and Steven Minor
results.brief_description: Explores time as a practical force, as an abstract concept and as a measure of life. Captures the art and wizardry used over the centuries to tell time.

results.title: Once upon a time
results.creator_credit: Film Workshop, Central Office of Information, Maxwell Munden and Dennis Shand
results.brief_description: A story of Britain’s contribution to the art of clock-making. The Greenwich Observatory was established during the reign of Charles II.; in 1764 a clock was made which would keep time for months on board ships, and so the problem of longitude was solved. Today, in the age of mass production, Britain’s clockwork industry maintains its high standards of precision and reliability.

results.title: Once upon a prime time
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, David Bairstow and Bernard Devlin
results.brief_description: A zany spoof with plenty of violence borrowed from the very source it seeks to parody, this film is about a housewife who has lost her family to the television set. Characters spring from the screen to invade her home and take over her life. She is saved by Buck the cowboy, who shoots everyone dead and rides off with her. Sam, her husband, witnesses the departure on his TV set. Stars: Edward Allen, Paul Berval, Christien Delmas, Basil Fitzgibbon, Gilles Pellerin, Joan Stuart, John Vernon, Chris Wiggins, Trudi Wiggins, Leslie Yeo, Ted Zeigler. Written by Stan Daniels; photographed by Jean Roy and Thomas Vamos; edited by Kathleen Shannon; sound by Ron Alexander, Andre Hourlier, John Knight and Roger Lamoureux.
